document.docAuthor: Maier, Crystal A. & Short, Andrew E. Z.
document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the Lutrochidae (Coleoptera) of Venezuela, with description of six new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the Lutrochidae (Coleoptera) of Venezuela, with description of six new species

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1. Habitat of
Lutrochus acuminatus
: Venezuela, Aragua State, Rio Castaño (collecting event VZ09-0106-01A). A) Arrow indicates a previously submerged log on which specimens were found (B).

FIGURE 2. Habitat of
Lutrochus violaceus
: A) Venezuela, Mérida State, 12 km SE Santo Domingo (collecting event VZ12- 0122-03B). Specimens (B) were found clinging to submerged stick and log debris (C).

FIGURE 3. Habitat of
Lutrochus
species. A)
L. meridaensis
: Venezuela, Mérida State, Cascada Velo de la Novia; specimens were collected on the vertical wet rocks adjacent to the waterfall (collecting event VZ09-0719-01A). B)
L.vestitus
: Venezuela, Falcón State, Cataratas del Hueque; specimens were found in the exposed tree root mats along the margin (collecting event VZ09-0709-01B).

subSubSection.paragraph: Female. Length 4.0 mm; width 2.0 mm. Externally similar to male, females generally larger than males.

Intraspecific Variation. This species varies considerably in size, ranging from 3.0– 4.3 mm long and 1.7–2.3 mm wide. Additionally, specimens vary slightly in color – from light reddish-brown to dark reddish-brown, specimens also have differing levels of setation, with patches where setae have rubbed off, as well as patches where setae have become matted down with grease.
Remarks. This species was previously the only named species in the family from Venezuela . This species is distinctive, not resembling any others found in Venezuela .
